title: Hubble captures intricacies of R Aquarii
summary: The NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope has provided a dramatic and colourful close-up look at one of the most boisterous stars in our galaxy, weaving a huge spiral pattern among the stars. Hubble's images capturing its details and its evolution are featured by a unique timelapse video.

title: NASA’s Hubble Sees a Stellar Volcano
summary: NASA’s Hubble Space Telescope has provided a dramatic and colorful close-up look at one of the most rambunctious stars in our galaxy, weaving a huge spiral pattern among the stars. Located approximately 700 light-years away, a binary star system called R Aquarii undergoes violent eruptions that blast out huge filaments of glowing gas. The twisted […]

title: Christine Knudson Uses Earthly Experience to Study Martian Geology
summary: Geologist Christine Knudson works with the Curiosity rover to explore Mars — from about 250 million miles away.

title: Avio to Continue MR10 Rocket Engine Testing This Month
summary: Italian rocket builder Avio has announced that it plans to test-fire its MR10 methalox rocket engine in the coming weeks. The MR10 engine is designed to power rocket upper stages and can produce up to 98 kN of thrust. It will initially power a pair of small demonstrators before it’s used aboard the upper stage […]

title: Zeroing in on the Icons: The 2024 SpaceNews Shortlist
summary: Announcing this year’s finalists for the SpaceNews Icon Awards, highlighting innovation, exploration and industry leadership. The SpaceNews Icon Awards celebrate the year’s most iconic achievements shaping the direction of the […]

title: China launches new Gaofen-12 remote sensing satellite
summary: MILAN — China added a fifth Gaofen-12 satellite to its national Earth observation system Tuesday, while providing no details regarding its capabilities. A Long March 4C rocket lifted off at […]

title: Axiom and Prada unveil design of Artemis spacesuit
summary: Axiom Space showed off the flight design of the Artemis spacesuit it is developing for NASA with the assistance of Prada.

title: Insuring commercial suborbital flights could be tricky, at least initially
summary: MILAN – When commercial suborbital spaceflight companies lose the liability protection they currently enjoy, insurance coverage may initially be quite expensive. That was the conclusion of a paper, by PwC […]

title: HydRON: Optical (laser-based) satellites for faster data sharing in space
summary: At the International Astronautical Congress (IAC) in Milan this week, ESA signed a contract for Element #1, the first phase of the HydRON Demonstration System. HydRON, which stands for High thRoughput Optical Network, is set to transform the way data-collecting satellites communicate, using laser technology that will allow satellites to connect with each other and ground networks much faster.

title: EarthCARE synergy reveals power of clouds and aerosols
summary: With the initial images from each of the instruments aboard ESA’s EarthCARE satellite now in hand, it's time to reveal how these four advanced sensors work in synergy to measure exactly how clouds and aerosols influence the heating and cooling of our atmosphere.
